pros: People are passionate about the work they do. They care for their patients and most staff gets along.
cons: You must be comfortable wearing different hats. It's a small organization so there is little room to growth.

review_title: Great mission and community. Not so great management
job_title: Youth Development Worker in Hyattsville, MD
pros:
-Great community mission 
-The clients we worked with were great 
-I could see that we were making a difference in people's lives
cons:
-Extremely clique and gossipy staff members 
-Management seemed to do favors only for those who would make an effort to build personal relationships with them 
-I never received a raise or change in compensation after over a year of working there. I had other co-workers who were there for years and had never even been approached about one. 
-People on my team were not treated equally, we often had to pick up the slack for others who were not pulling their weight 
-There was no room to give our managers to feedback on their managing styles. We were often yelled at, singled out, or bullied
-When I raised concerns about these things to my manager no one really did anything to change the issues

job_title: Patient Access Representative in Washington, DC
pros: For the most part everyone at La Clinica Del Pueblo is really welcoming and makes you feel like family.
cons: There are multiple con's at La Clinica that I wish to not disclose at the moment
